page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Mr.W.A.Bragg},boy in St.Stephen 1920 .Remembered that water for village came from pump or well and was fetched every day in buckets.Cooking was done on Cornish range.Shopping mostly done in village store but milk brought to door by farmer who dipped from churn .Horse main form of transport,shires used to pull clay waggons and horses worked on farms.Local roads made with tar, chippings and steamroller. Houses had oil lamps and candles.No street lights.Village children at local school from 5-15.Football played with pigs bladder.Iron hoops made by local blacksmith to roll and run.{Church}was compulsory on Sunday morning,afternoon and evening.Band of Hope tea treat in summer preceded by march through village with bands and banners.Special tea buns and tea were provided.
